Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Understand the DECLARE Model Structure in pm4py: The prompt specifies the keys and their value structures. Group 1 Unary Constraints: existence, absence, exactly_one, init. Value structure: Dict[ActivityName, Dict[str, float]]. Group 2 Binary Constraints: responded_existence, coexistence, response, precedence, succession, altresponse, altprecedence, altsuccession, chainresponse, chainprecedence, chainsuccession, noncoexistence, nonsuccession, nonchainsuccession.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The prompt says for binary keys, the value is a dictionary containing as keys the activities and as corresponding value the support and confidence. This phrasing is slightly ambiguous for binary constraints. Standard pm4py DECLARE discovery output usually has Binary: response: {('A', 'B'): {'support': ..., 'confidence': ...}}. Assume the standard structure for binary constraints involves tuples (SourceActivity, TargetActivity) as keys.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Analyze the Scenario Logic: Activities: IG Idea Generation, DD Design Draft, TFC Technical Feasibility Check, CE Cost Evaluation, PC Prototype Creation, LT Laboratory Testing, UT User Testing, AG Approval Gate, MP Marketing Plan, FL Final Launch. Proposed flow: IG -> DD -> (TFC, CE) -> PC -> (LT, UT) -> AG -> MP -> FL.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Proposed Constraints: Init: IG. Existence: IG, DD, TFC, CE, PC, AG, FL. Response: If IG then DD, If DD then TFC and CE, If PC then LT and UT, If AG then FL. Precedence: DD preceded by IG, TFC/CE preceded by DD, PC preceded by TFC/CE, AG preceded by PC/LT/UT, FL preceded by AG/MP.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Scenario Check: Prototype Creation based on the approved design but AG is listed after testing. Prompt Order: IG, DD, TFC, CE, PC, LT, UT, AG, MP, FL. Flow: IG -> DD -> TFC/CE -> PC -> LT/UT -> AG -> MP -> FL. Assume AG comes after testing.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Select a representative set of constraints: Init: IG. Existence: IG, FL. Response: (IG, DD), (DD, TFC), (AG, FL). Precedence: (IG, DD), (AG, FL). Avoid chain succession to keep realistic.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Drafting the Content: init: {'IG': {'support': 1.0, 'confidence': 1.0}}. existence: {'IG': ..., 'FL': ...}. response: {('IG', 'DD'): ..., ('DD', 'TFC'): ..., ('DD', 'CE'): ..., ('AG', 'FL'): ...}. precedence similar.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Refining the Structure based on Prompt details: Unary: {'Activity': {'support': 1.0, 'confidence': 1.0}}. Binary: {('Activity1', 'Activity2'): {'support': 1.0, 'confidence': 1.0}}. Proceed with tuple keys.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Constructing the specific rules: Start with IG so init IG. Existence: IG, AG, FL. Response: (IG, DD), (DD, TFC), (PC, LT), (AG, FL). Precedence: (IG, DD), (DD, TFC), (AG, FL).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Constraint Logic Review: Init IG start. Existence IG, FL, AG critical. Exactly One IG, FL. Response and Precedence matching flow. Responded Existence, Coexistence for pairs like DD TFC.
